hints_html: The augmented matrix is the matrix A with an extra column, how do we get the numbers for that extra column?
hints_latex:
The augmented matrix is the matrix A with an extra column, how do we get
the numbers for that extra column?
hints_raw: The augmented matrix is the matrix A with an extra column, how do we get the numbers for that extra column?
question: B 01 (b)
sols_html:
From B1(a) we have that

\[\begin{aligned} A=\begin{bmatrix} 1 & -2 & 0\\ 8 & 0 & 8\\ 16 & 16 & 16 \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

and

\[\begin{aligned} \mathbf{b}=\begin{bmatrix} 0\\ 6\\ 14 \end{bmatrix}.\end{aligned}\]

The augmented matrix for \(A\mathbf{x}=\mathbf{b}\) is \([A|\mathbf{b}]\). This says to take the matrix \(A\) and add the vector \(\mathbf{b}\) as an extra column. Therefore the augmented matrix is

\[\begin{aligned} \left[\begin{array}{ccc|c} 1 & -2 & 0 & 0\\ 8 & 0 & 8 & 6\\ 16 & 16 & 16 & 14 \end{array}\right]\end{aligned}\]
statement_html:
Three friends, Hartosh, Mark and Keiko decide to paint houses over the summer. Hartosh paints twice as fast as Mark. Hartosh and Keiko paint a home with six rooms in 8 hours. All three together paint a home with 14 rooms in 16 hours.

(b) Write the system you found above in augmented matrix form.
statement_latex:
Three friends, Hartosh, Mark and Keiko decide to paint houses over the
summer. Hartosh paints twice as fast as Mark. Hartosh and Keiko paint a
home with six rooms in 8 hours. All three together paint a home with 14
rooms in 16 hours.

\textbf{(b)} Write the system you found above in augmented matrix form.
statement_raw:
Three friends, Hartosh, Mark and Keiko decide to paint houses over the summer. Hartosh paints twice as fast as Mark. Hartosh and Keiko paint a home with six rooms in 8 hours. All three together paint a home with 14 rooms in 16 hours.

'''(b)''' Write the system you found above in augmented matrix form.
